author: R Sivaraman
text:
Alleges that functionaries have been spreading canards

Congress party Puducherry unit president A. Namassivayam on Sunday said there is no discreet talk between Congress and ruling All India NR Congress (AINRC) led by Chief Minister N. Rangasamy.

Mr. Namassivayam alleged the functionaries have been spreading canards in view of rising popularity of Congress party in the Union Territory.

Interactions with

leaders

At the party office on Sunday, Mr. Namassivayam held discussion with vice-presidents of party and senior leaders to chalk out poll strategy for the forthcoming elections.

Later talking to press persons, he said, “The seat-sharing talks between Congress and DMK will be held in Chennai next week. High-level leaders of Congress party from New Delhi will come to down to Chennai to participate in the talks.

Then they will take the final decision on the number of seats each party would contest Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.”

Panel preparing manifesto

He added that a committee under the Leader of Opposition V. Vaithilingam has been preparing the party manifesto. After obtaining approval from the party high command, the manifesto for the Union Territory would be released shortly.

The Congress leader said the AINRC had taken the Union Territory backwards by a decade in terms of growth. He added his party would campaign against the AINRC citing its failures during the last five years.
title: “No discreet talks between Congress, AINRC”
